thread.title: Here’s Why People Are Putting Purple Yams In Their Desserts
thread.title_full: Here’s Why People Are Putting Purple Yams In Their Desserts

author: ahrustic1
title: Here’s Why People Are Putting Purple Yams In Their Desserts
text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
If you have a sweet tooth that won’t quit, you’ve probably already tried making healthier versions of your favorite treats. Restaurants all over the country have taken note of the “healthy dessert” trend, but one standout ingredient has taken center stage on social media: a vegetable called ube . It’s a purple yam, in the same family as sweet potatoes, that’s mashed and blended into your favorite desserts, like ice cream, frosting, and pies, reports TIME . 
Like your typical orange yams, ube—a staple in the Philippines—is a great source of healthy carbs, fiber, vitamins, and potassium. But research indicates ube’s purple pigment packs an extra nutritional punch: One recent study found that purple yams are loaded with antioxidants like anthocyanins , which are responsible for the purple color. Some research suggests that a diet packed with these antioxidants can promote heart and brain health , and possibly even protect you from cancer, according to the USDA. Advertisement
